onset.Description: Position (latency) of event marker in seconds relative to the start.

duration.Description: Duration of the event, set typically to n/a. Instead, the duration of the event is determined by the onset/offset flags or the next event.

sample.Description: Temporal position (latency) of event marker relative to the start, in data frames.

Levels.instructed_toOpenEyes: A voice prompt instructed subject to open their eyes
Levels.instructed_toCloseEyes: A voice prompt instructed subject to open their eyes
Levels.resting_start: Recording of Resting State task started

HED.instructed_toOpenEyes: Sensory-event, Instructional, Cue, (Auditory-presentation, Loudspeaker, ((Human-agent, Female), (Speak, (Sentence, Label/now-open-your-eyes))))
HED.instructed_toCloseEyes: Sensory-event, Instructional, Cue, (Auditory-presentation, Loudspeaker, ((Human-agent, Female), (Speak, (Sentence, Label/now-close-your-eyes))))

event_code.Description: The original code used during data collection to indicate an event marker.

Levels.20: A voice prompt instructed subject to open their eyes
Levels.30: A voice prompt instructed subject to open their eyes
Levels.90: Recording of Resting State task started
